definition[0]: based on general ideas or principles rather than specific examples or real events
example[0]: By the age of seven, children are capable of thinking in abstract terms.
example[1]: Human beings are the only creatures capable of abstract thought  (=thinking about ideas).
example[2]: the ability to translate abstract ideas into words
definition[1]: existing only as an idea or quality rather than as something real that you can see or touch
definition[2]: abstract paintings, designs etc consist of shapes and patterns that do not look like real people or things
definition[3]: a painting, design etc which contains shapes or images that do not look like real things or people
definition[4]: a short written statement containing only the most important ideas in a speech, article etc
definition[5]: to write a document containing the most important ideas or points from a speech, article etc
definition[7]: a short written statement that contains the most important details of a longer piece of writing such as a newspaper article, a report, or a speech
example[4]: an abstract of the Chairmanâ€™s speech to the shareholders
